title: Update regarding FinCorp
story_body:
FinCorp, the Springfield-based financial services firm, has announced a series of personnel changes within its regional management team. Effective immediately, Emily Chen, formerly a senior vice president at the company's downtown Springfield office, will take on the role of regional manager for the firm's central Illinois operations.

In her new capacity, Chen will oversee a team of 50 employees spread across FinCorp's Springfield, Champaign, and Decatur branches. Prior to her promotion, Chen played a key role in the development of FinCorp's community outreach initiatives, including partnerships with the Springfield Chamber of Commerce and the United Way of Central Illinois.

In other news, FinCorp has launched a new marketing campaign aimed at promoting its mobile banking services to local residents. The campaign, which features print and digital advertisements in the Springfield Journal-Register and other regional publications, highlights the convenience and security of FinCorp's mobile banking platform.

On the environmental, social, and governance (ESG) front, FinCorp has announced plans to reduce its energy consumption at its Springfield headquarters by 10% over the next 12 months. As part of this initiative, the company will be installing new energy-efficient lighting and HVAC systems, as well as promoting sustainable commuting practices among its 200 local employees.

FinCorp's ESG efforts have been recognized by local officials, including Springfield Mayor, Jim Langfelder, who praised the company's commitment to reducing its environmental footprint. "FinCorp's efforts to reduce its energy consumption are a great example of the kind of sustainable practices we're encouraging in our city," Langfelder said.
